meanings.definition: To rise in rebellion against an authority or government.
meanings.sent1: The people in the town revolts against the unfair rules.
meanings.sent2: The citizens decided to stage a revolt against the oppressive regime.
meanings.sent3: The idea of having to wear a uniform to school revolts the students.
meanings.sent4: The thought of being controlled by others revolts me to my core.
meanings.sent5: The image of the brave rebels fighting for freedom revolts in my mind.

meanings.definition: To cause disgust or shock in someone.
meanings.sent1: The rotten smell from the garbage revolts my senses.
meanings.sent2: The gruesome scene in the movie revolts the audience.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating insects may revolts some people, but others find it delicious.
meanings.sent4: The graphic details of the crime scene revolts even the seasoned detectives.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the decaying food revolts the chef's culinary sensibilities.

meanings.definition: A violent uprising against an authority or government.
meanings.sent1: The history books are filled with stories of revolts against tyrannical rulers.
meanings.sent2: The peasants organized a revolt to demand better working conditions.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show portrayed a humorous version of a kitchen utensil revolt.
meanings.sent4: The revolt of the machines in the science fiction movie was both thrilling and terrifying.
meanings.sent5: The student-led revolt for better cafeteria food gained widespread support.
